body:
<!-- Please only use this template for submitting reports about failing tests in Kubernetes CI jobs -->

**Which jobs are failing**:
N/A
**Which test(s) are failing**:
```
[sig-network] Networking should provide Internet connection for containers [Feature:Networking-IPv4]
```
**Since when has it been failing**:
Ever
**Reason for failure**:
Vm on Azure with no public IP assigned aren't able to perform a `ping` command to the internet.

**Anything else we need to know**:
```golang
It("should provide Internet connection for containers [Feature:Networking-IPv4]", func() {
	By("Running container which tries to ping 8.8.8.8")
	framework.ExpectNoError(
	framework.CheckConnectivityToHost(f, "", "ping-test", "8.8.8.8", framework.IPv4PingCommand, 30))
})
```
The test (see [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e/network/networking.go#L48)) tries to test the internet connection for a pod by pinging 8.8.8.8. 
But azure does not provide ICMP support for VM without a public IP therefore this test cannot succeed.(see [Azure docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/load-balancer/load-balancer-outbound-connections))

A fix would be to change the test method to a tcp request instead of a ping request (the test already performs a http get to google.com in its BeforeSuite (see [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e/network/networking.go#L38)))
```golang
BeforeEach(func() {
	// Assert basic external connectivity.
	// Since this is not really a test of kubernetes in any way, we
	// leave it as a pre-test assertion, rather than a Ginko test.
	By("Executing a successful http request from the external internet")
	resp, err := http.Get("http://google.com")
	if err != nil {
		framework.Failf("Unable to connect/talk to the internet: %v", err)
	}
	if resp.StatusCode != http.StatusOK {
		framework.Failf("Unexpected error code, expected 200, got, %v (%v)", resp.StatusCode, resp)
	}
})
```

labels.description: Issues or PRs related to azure provider
labels.name: area/provider/azure

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a consistently or frequently failing test.
labels.name: kind/failing-test

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Network.
labels.name: sig/network

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: Network internet test for pod fails on azure
